panels.description:
Throttling can occur if the processor overheats or the power supply is inadequate. 

Raspberry Pi boards begin to throttle the processor when the temperature reaches 80°C, and throttle even further when it reaches the max temp of 85°C.
panels.title: Currently Throttled

panels.description: ARM frequency can be capped or throttled when the system's power supply is inadequate, it overheats, or it hits a configured maximum clock speed
panels.title: Freq. Cap

panels.description:
Reached a temperature that triggers a performance reduction, but not an emergency shutdown.

Raspberry Pi boards begin to throttle the processor when the temperature reaches 80°C, and throttle even further when it reaches the max temp of 85°C.
panels.title: Soft Temp. Limit Active
